extraction_details.text: IMMEDIATELY: Give patient John Smith 1mg IV push of vasopressin for NSTEMI.
CRITICAL: Give patient John Smith give 10mg now of vasopressin for STEMI.
EMERGENT: Give patient John Smith give 1mg now of epinephrine for cardiogenic shock.
CRITICAL: Give patient John Smith 1mg IV push of epinephrine for NSTEMI.
EMERGENT: Give patient John Smith 10mg IV push of epinephrine for STEMI.
IMMEDIATELY: Give patient John Smith 2mg IV push of vasopressin for cardiac arrest.
NOW: Give patient John Smith 1mg IV push of norepinephrine for NSTEMI.
STAT: Give patient John Smith give 10mg now of norepinephrine for VT/VF.
CRITICAL: Give patient John Smith 5mcg bolus of norepinephrine for NSTEMI.
EMERGENT: Give patient John Smith 5mg IV push of dopamine for cardiac arrest.
Start neonate patient (weight: 12kg) on cephalexin 25mg/kg/day divided BID for pharyngitis.
Start child patient (weight: 18kg) on azithromycin 15mg/kg/day divided BID for UTI.
Start neonate patient (weight: 8kg) on amoxicillin 25mg/kg/day divided BID for pharyngitis.
Start infant patient (weight: 12kg) on azithromycin 25mg/kg/day divided BID for UTI.
Start toddler patient (weight: 18kg) on cephalexin 10mg/kg/day divided BID for otitis media.
Start child patient (weight: 12kg) on clindamycin 20mg/kg/day divided BID for otitis media.
Start adolescent patient (weight: 8kg) on clindamycin 10mg/kg/day divided BID for pneumonia.
Start neonate patient (weight: 12kg) on cephalexin 20mg/kg/day divided BID for pneumonia.
Start neonate patient (weight: 8kg) on amoxicillin 10mg/kg/day divided BID for otitis media.
Start adolescent patient (weight: 8kg) on cephalexin 25mg/kg/day divided BID for otitis media.
Start patient on lisinopril 5mg daily for systolic dysfunction. Monitor electrolytes in 1 week.
Start patient on captopril 5mg daily for diastolic dysfunction. Monitor electrolytes in 1 week.
Start patient on enalapril 5mg daily for cardiomyopathy. Monitor INR in 1 week.
Start patient on ramipril 5mg daily for CHF. Monitor electrolytes in 1 week.
Start patient on captopril 5mg daily for cardiomyopathy. Monitor INR in 1 week.
Start patient on enalapril 5mg daily for diastolic dysfunction. Monitor electrolytes in 1 week.
Start patient on captopril 5mg daily for diastolic dysfunction. Monitor renal function in 1 week.
Start patient on enalapril 5mg daily for CHF. Monitor PT/PTT in 1 week.
Start patient on captopril 5mg daily for diastolic dysfunction. Monitor PT/PTT in 1 week.
Start patient on captopril 5mg daily for CHF. Monitor PT/PTT in 1 week.
Patient with lung cancer: give carboplatin 75mg/m2 day 1 every 21 days.
Patient with breast cancer: give paclitaxel 75mg/m2 day 1 and 8 q28 days.
Patient with colon cancer: give carboplatin 100mg/m2 day 1 and 8 q28 days.
Patient with lung cancer: give carboplatin 100mg/m2 day 1 every 21 days.
Patient with breast cancer: give doxorubicin 100mg/m2 day 1 every 21 days.
Patient with lung cancer: give cyclophosphamide 75mg/m2 day 1 and 8 q28 days.
Patient with ovarian cancer: give docetaxel 50mg/m2 day 1 and 8 q28 days.
Patient with colon cancer: give paclitaxel 50mg/m2 day 1 and 8 q28 days.
Patient with breast cancer: give paclitaxel 75mg/m2 day 1 and 8 q28 days.
Patient with lung cancer: give docetaxel 100mg/m2 day 1 and 8 q28 days.
